div.p: Элементы identifier и version можно использовать для ссылки на данную кодовую систему в наборе значений, в шаблоне CDA или сообщении HL7 v3 (в типе данных CD свойства codeSystem и codeSystemVersion). Эти различные контексты могут вносить дополнительные ограничения на возможные значения этих элементов. В этих элементах обычно нет необходимости при использовании кодовых систем в FHIR-реализациях, поскольку они могут использовать внутренний идентификатор и механизм версионирования, ассоциированный с этим ресурсом.
Each code system can have one or more properties. Each concept defined by the code system may have one more values for each property defined by the code system. Typical uses for properties include:

ul.li: Providing additional statements about the meaning of the concept
Defining structured relationships with other concepts in the code system
Assigning scoring values to the concepts

div.p: Properties are identified by their code (CodeSystem.property.code), which is used both internally within the code system resource (CodeSystem.concept.property.code) and also externally, in the following places:

ul.li: ValueSet: ValueSet.compose.include.filter.property can refer to any defined code system property
$lookup operation: In Parameters.parameter.name when returning information about a code
$translate operation: In Parameters.parameter.part.name for dependencies and products
$infer operation: In Parameters.parameter.name when providing codes, and in Parameters.parameter.name when asking for codes

div.p: Properties are defined using the following elements:

tr.td: Used to identify the property, as enumerated above

Reference to the formal meaning of the property. One possible source of meaning is the Concept Properties code system. This part of the definition is optional, but is recommended to provide an additional level of definitional consistency
A description of the property- why it is defined, and how it's value might be used
code | Coding | string | integer | boolean | dateTime
The type of the property value. Properties of type "code" contain a code defined by the code system (e.g. a reference to anotherr defined concept)

div.p: Note that properties provide a common view of concept relationships that is common across all code systems. Some code systems define properties with more sophistication, such as groups of properties, or subsumption relationships between properties (e.g. SNOMED CT). Servers providing support for these code systems will need to know full details about the underlying relationships in order to provide the correct information about concepts and their properties, but this information does not surface in the resources or operations defined by the FHIR specification.
